1â†’# Tasks: ANSI Common Lisp Multiple Values Support
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/025-multiple-values/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: Required per Constitution Principle VII (TDD Non-negotiable)
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root
    19â†’
    20â†’---
    21â†’
    22â†’## Phase 1: Setup
    23â†’
    24â†’**Purpose**: No additional setup needed - using existing clysm project structure
    25â†’
    26â†’*Phase skipped - project already initialized*
    27â†’
    28â†’---
    29â†’
    30â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    31â†’
    32â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    33â†’
    34â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    35â†’
    36â†’- [ ] T001 Add $mv-array type definition to type section in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/gc-types.lisp
    37â†’- [ ] T002 Add *mv-count-global-index* constant (= 2) in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    38â†’- [ ] T003 Add *mv-buffer-global-index* constant (= 3) in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    39â†’- [ ] T004 Implement make-mv-count-global function in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    40â†’- [ ] T005 Implement make-mv-buffer-global function in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    41â†’- [ ] T006 Update *global-counter* initial value from 2 to 4 in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    42â†’- [ ] T007 Update reset-global-counter to reset to 4 in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
    43â†’- [ ] T008 Update compiler.lisp to include mv-count and mv-buffer globals in module initialization in src/clysm/compiler/compiler.lisp
    44â†’- [ ] T009 [P] Contract test: verify mv globals exist in compiled output in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp
    45â†’
    46â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    47â†’
    48â†’---
    49â†’
    50â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Return Multiple Values (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    51â†’
    52â†’**Goal**: Implement `values` special form that returns multiple values
    53â†’
    54â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(values 1 2 3)` and verify primary value (1) is returned, secondary values accessible
    55â†’
    56â†’### Tests for User Story 1
    57â†’
    58â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    59â†’
    60â†’- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values) returning NIL with count=0 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    61â†’- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values 42) returning 42 with count=1 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    62â†’- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values 1 2 3) returning 1 with count=3 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    63â†’- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Contract test for values Wasm codegen in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp
    64â†’
    65â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    66â†’
    67â†’- [ ] T014 [US1] Add values to special form dispatch in compile-special-form in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    68â†’- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement compile-values function for zero arguments case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    69â†’- [ ] T016 [US1] Implement compile-values function for single argument case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    70â†’- [ ] T017 [US1] Implement compile-values function for multiple arguments case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    71â†’- [ ] T018 [US1] Verify tests pass and Wasm validates with wasm-tools validate
    72â†’
    73â†’**Checkpoint**: `values` form works - can return multiple values from functions
    74â†’
    75â†’---
    76â†’
    77â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Bind Multiple Values (Priority: P1)
    78â†’
    79â†’**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-bind` to capture returned values into variables
    80â†’
    81â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-bind (a b) (values 1 2) (+ a b))` and verify result is 3
    82â†’
    83â†’### Tests for User Story 2
    84â†’
    85â†’- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Unit test for basic mvb binding two values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    86â†’- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with fewer values than variables (NIL fill) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    87â†’- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with more values than variables (extras ignored) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    88â†’- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with empty variable list in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
    89â†’- [ ] T023 [P] [US2] Contract test for mvb Wasm codegen in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp
    90â†’
    91â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
    92â†’
    93â†’- [ ] T024 [US2] Add multiple-value-bind to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    94â†’- [ ] T025 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: evaluate value form and store primary in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    95â†’- [ ] T026 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: read secondary values from buffer with count check in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    96â†’- [ ] T027 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: bind variables and compile body in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    97â†’- [ ] T028 [US2] Verify tests pass and Wasm validates
    98â†’
    99â†’**Checkpoint**: Can receive multiple values from function calls
   100â†’
   101â†’---
   102â†’
   103â†’## Phase 5: User Story 8 - Arithmetic Functions (Priority: P1)
   104â†’
   105â†’**Goal**: Update `floor`, `truncate`, `ceiling`, `round` to return (quotient remainder) as two values
   106â†’
   107â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-list (floor 7 3))` and verify result is `(2 1)`
   108â†’
   109â†’### Tests for User Story 8
   110â†’

   112â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US8] Unit test for truncate with negative numbers in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
   113â†’- [ ] T031 [P] [US8] Unit test for ceiling returning quotient and remainder in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
   114â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US8] Unit test for round returning quotient and remainder in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
   115â†’
   116â†’### Implementation for User Story 8

   121â†’- [ ] T036 [P] [US8] Implement compile-ceiling with multiple values in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   122â†’- [ ] T037 [P] [US8] Implement compile-round with multiple values in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

   126â†’
   127â†’---
   128â†’
   129â†’## Phase 6: User Story 3 - Collect as List (Priority: P2)
   130â†’
   131â†’**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-list` to collect all returned values into a list
   132â†’
   133â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-list (values 1 2 3))` and verify result is `(1 2 3)`
   134â†’
   135â†’### Tests for User Story 3
   136â†’
   137â†’- [ ] T039 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with zero values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
   138â†’- [ ] T040 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with multiple values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
   139â†’- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with floor result in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

   141â†’### Implementation for User Story 3

   152â†’## Phase 7: User Story 4 - Access by Index (Priority: P2)
   153â†’
   154â†’**Goal**: Implement `nth-value` to access a specific value by index
   155â†’
   156â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(nth-value 1 (values 'a 'b 'c))` and verify result is `B`
   157â†’
   158â†’### Tests for User Story 4
   159â†’
   160â†’- [ ] T046 [P] [US4] Unit test for nth-value index 0 (primary) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

   162â†’- [ ] T048 [P] [US4] Unit test for nth-value index out of range (returns NIL) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

   176â†’

   180â†’

   183â†’- [ ] T053 [P] [US5] Unit test for values-list with nil in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

   221â†’---

   246â†’
   247â†’## Phase 11: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   248â†’
   249â†’**Purpose**: Integration tests, ANSI compliance verification, cleanup

   251â†’- [ ] T077 [P] Integration test: full ANSI compliance scenarios in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
   252â†’- [ ] T078 [P] Integration test: edge cases from spec.md in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
   253â†’- [ ] T079 [P] Integration test: backward compatibility - single-value code unchanged in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
   254â†’- [ ] T080 Verify all generated Wasm validates with wasm-tools validate

   258â†’---
   259â†’
   260â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   261â†’
   262â†’### Phase Dependencies
   263â†’
   264â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: Skipped - using existing project
   265â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: No dependencies - can start immediately - **BLOCKS all user stories**
   266â†’- **User Stories (Phase 3-10)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   267â†’- **Polish (Phase 11)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   268â†’
   269â†’### User Story Dependencies
   270â†’
   271â†’```
   272â†’Phase 2 (Foundational)
   273â†’    â”‚
   274â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 3 (US1: values) â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

   277â†’    â”‚       â”‚                                     â”‚                          â”‚

   279â†’    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚

   283â†’    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚
   284â†’    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 9 (US6)  â”‚

   292â†’
   293â†’- **US1 (values)**: Foundational only - MVP target
   294â†’- **US2 (mvb)**: Depends on US1 (needs values infrastructure)
   295â†’- **US8 (arithmetic)**: Depends on US1 (needs values infrastructure)
   296â†’- **US3 (mvl)**: Depends on US1+US2 (needs both for testing)
   297â†’- **US4-7**: Can proceed after US1, independent of each other
   298â†’
   299â†’### Within Each User Story
   300â†’
   301â†’1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation
   302â†’2. Implementation tasks execute sequentially within a story
   303â†’3. Story complete when all tests pass
   304â†’
   305â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   306â†’
   307â†’- T001-T008: Sequential (dependencies)
   308â†’- T009: Can run after T008
   309â†’- T010-T013: All parallel (different test cases)
   310â†’- T014-T017: Sequential (building up values implementation)
   311â†’- T019-T023: All parallel (different test cases)
   312â†’- T029-T032: All parallel (different arithmetic functions)
   313â†’- T035-T037: All parallel (different arithmetic functions)
   314â†’- T039-T041, T046-T048, T053-T055, T061-T062, T069-T071, T077-T079: Each group parallel
   315â†’
   316â†’---
   317â†’
   318â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   319â†’
   320â†’```bash
   321â†’# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together:
   322â†’Task: T010 "Unit test for (values) returning NIL"
   323â†’Task: T011 "Unit test for (values 42)"
   324â†’Task: T012 "Unit test for (values 1 2 3)"
   325â†’Task: T013 "Contract test for values Wasm codegen"
   326â†’
   327â†’# After tests fail, implement sequentially:
   328â†’Task: T014 "Add values to special form dispatch"
   329â†’Task: T015 "Implement zero arguments case"
   330â†’Task: T016 "Implement single argument case"
   331â†’Task: T017 "Implement multiple arguments case"
   332â†’Task: T018 "Verify tests pass"
   333â†’```
   334â†’
   335â†’---
   336â†’
   337â†’## Implementation Strategy
   338â†’
   339â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   340â†’
   341â†’1. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T001-T009)
   342â†’2. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (T010-T018)
   343â†’3. **STOP and VALIDATE**: `(values 1 2 3)` compiles and returns correctly
   344â†’4. Deliverable: Basic multiple values infrastructure
   345â†’
   346â†’### P1 Complete (Stories 1, 2, 8)
   347â†’
   348â†’1. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
   349â†’2. Complete Phase 3: US1 (values)
   350â†’3. Complete Phase 4: US2 (multiple-value-bind)
   351â†’4. Complete Phase 5: US8 (floor/truncate/ceiling/round)
   352â†’5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: `(multiple-value-bind (q r) (floor 7 3) ...)` works
   353â†’6. Deliverable: Core multiple values functionality
   354â†’
   355â†’### Full Implementation
   356â†’
   357â†’1. P1 stories â†’ P2 stories â†’ P3 stories â†’ Polish
   358â†’2. Each story adds capability without breaking previous
   359â†’
   360â†’---
   361â†’
   362â†’## Task Summary
   363â†’
   364â†’| Phase | Story | Task Count |
   365â†’|-------|-------|------------|
   366â†’| 2 | Foundational | 9 |
   367â†’| 3 | US1 (values) | 9 |
   368â†’| 4 | US2 (mvb) | 10 |
   369â†’| 5 | US8 (arithmetic) | 10 |

   371â†’| 7 | US4 (nth-value) | 7 |
   372â†’| 8 | US5 (values-list) | 8 |
   373â†’| 9 | US6 (mvp1) | 8 |
   374â†’| 10 | US7 (mvc) | 8 |
   375â†’| 11 | Polish | 6 |
   376â†’| **Total** | | **82** |
   377â†’
   378â†’---
   379â†’
   380â†’## Notes
   381â†’
   382â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   383â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   384â†’- Each user story should be independently completable and testable

file.content:
# Tasks: ANSI Common Lisp Multiple Values Support

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/025-multiple-values/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: Required per Constitution Principle VII (TDD Non-negotiable)

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root

---

## Phase 1: Setup

**Purpose**: No additional setup needed - using existing clysm project structure

*Phase skipped - project already initialized*

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T001 Add $mv-array type definition to type section in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/gc-types.lisp
- [ ] T002 Add *mv-count-global-index* constant (= 2) in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T003 Add *mv-buffer-global-index* constant (= 3) in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T004 Implement make-mv-count-global function in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T005 Implement make-mv-buffer-global function in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T006 Update *global-counter* initial value from 2 to 4 in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T007 Update reset-global-counter to reset to 4 in src/clysm/runtime/objects.lisp
- [ ] T008 Update compiler.lisp to include mv-count and mv-buffer globals in module initialization in src/clysm/compiler/compiler.lisp
- [ ] T009 [P] Contract test: verify mv globals exist in compiled output in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Return Multiple Values (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Implement `values` special form that returns multiple values

**Independent Test**: Compile `(values 1 2 3)` and verify primary value (1) is returned, secondary values accessible

### Tests for User Story 1

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values) returning NIL with count=0 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values 42) returning 42 with count=1 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Unit test for (values 1 2 3) returning 1 with count=3 in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Contract test for values Wasm codegen in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T014 [US1] Add values to special form dispatch in compile-special-form in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement compile-values function for zero arguments case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T016 [US1] Implement compile-values function for single argument case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T017 [US1] Implement compile-values function for multiple arguments case in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T018 [US1] Verify tests pass and Wasm validates with wasm-tools validate

**Checkpoint**: `values` form works - can return multiple values from functions

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Bind Multiple Values (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-bind` to capture returned values into variables

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-bind (a b) (values 1 2) (+ a b))` and verify result is 3

### Tests for User Story 2

- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Unit test for basic mvb binding two values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with fewer values than variables (NIL fill) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with more values than variables (extras ignored) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Unit test for mvb with empty variable list in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T023 [P] [US2] Contract test for mvb Wasm codegen in tests/contract/mv-wasm-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T024 [US2] Add multiple-value-bind to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T025 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: evaluate value form and store primary in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T026 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: read secondary values from buffer with count check in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T027 [US2] Implement compile-multiple-value-bind: bind variables and compile body in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T028 [US2] Verify tests pass and Wasm validates

**Checkpoint**: Can receive multiple values from function calls

---

## Phase 5: User Story 8 - Arithmetic Functions (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Update `floor`, `truncate`, `ceiling`, `round` to return (quotient remainder) as two values

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-list (floor 7 3))` and verify result is `(2 1)`

### Tests for User Story 8

- [ ] T029 [P] [US8] Unit test for floor returning quotient and remainder in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T030 [P] [US8] Unit test for truncate with negative numbers in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T031 [P] [US8] Unit test for ceiling returning quotient and remainder in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T032 [P] [US8] Unit test for round returning quotient and remainder in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 8

- [ ] T033 [US8] Update compile-floor to compute remainder and store in mv-buffer[0] in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T034 [US8] Update compile-floor to set mv-count=2 and return quotient in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T035 [P] [US8] Implement compile-truncate with multiple values in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T036 [P] [US8] Implement compile-ceiling with multiple values in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T037 [P] [US8] Implement compile-round with multiple values in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T038 [US8] Verify tests pass and all arithmetic functions return two values

**Checkpoint**: All P1 user stories complete - arithmetic functions return multiple values

---

## Phase 6: User Story 3 - Collect as List (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-list` to collect all returned values into a list

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-list (values 1 2 3))` and verify result is `(1 2 3)`

### Tests for User Story 3

- [ ] T039 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with zero values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T040 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with multiple values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Unit test for mvl with floor result in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T042 [US3] Add multiple-value-list to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T043 [US3] Implement compile-multiple-value-list: evaluate form and get primary value in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T044 [US3] Implement compile-multiple-value-list: loop over mv-buffer building list in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T045 [US3] Verify tests pass

**Checkpoint**: Can collect multiple values into lists

---

## Phase 7: User Story 4 - Access by Index (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement `nth-value` to access a specific value by index

**Independent Test**: Compile `(nth-value 1 (values 'a 'b 'c))` and verify result is `B`

### Tests for User Story 4

- [ ] T046 [P] [US4] Unit test for nth-value index 0 (primary) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T047 [P] [US4] Unit test for nth-value index 2 (secondary) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T048 [P] [US4] Unit test for nth-value index out of range (returns NIL) in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 4

- [ ] T049 [US4] Add nth-value to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T050 [US4] Implement compile-nth-value: evaluate index and form in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T051 [US4] Implement compile-nth-value: check index against mv-count and return value or NIL in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T052 [US4] Verify tests pass

**Checkpoint**: Can access specific values by index

---

## Phase 8: User Story 5 - Spread List as Values (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement `values-list` to convert a list into multiple values

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-list (values-list '(1 2 3)))` and verify result is `(1 2 3)`

### Tests for User Story 5

- [ ] T053 [P] [US5] Unit test for values-list with nil in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T054 [P] [US5] Unit test for values-list with proper list in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T055 [P] [US5] Unit test for values-list type error with non-list in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 5

- [ ] T056 [US5] Add values-list to function dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T057 [US5] Implement compile-values-list: type check for list or nil in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T058 [US5] Implement compile-values-list: iterate list storing in buffer and counting in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T059 [US5] Implement compile-values-list: signal type-error if not list in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T060 [US5] Verify tests pass

**Checkpoint**: Can spread lists as multiple values

---

## Phase 9: User Story 6 - Preserve Values (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-prog1` to preserve values through side-effect forms

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-prog1 (values 1 2) (print 'done))` and verify returns 1, 2

### Tests for User Story 6

- [ ] T061 [P] [US6] Unit test for mvp1 preserving multiple values in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T062 [P] [US6] Unit test for mvp1 with single value in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 6

- [ ] T063 [US6] Add multiple-value-prog1 to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T064 [US6] Implement compile-multiple-value-prog1: save primary value and mv-count in locals in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T065 [US6] Implement compile-multiple-value-prog1: save buffer contents to local array in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T066 [US6] Implement compile-multiple-value-prog1: execute body forms for side effects in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T067 [US6] Implement compile-multiple-value-prog1: restore mv-count and buffer, return primary in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T068 [US6] Verify tests pass

**Checkpoint**: Can preserve multiple values through evaluation

---

## Phase 10: User Story 7 - Pass Values to Functions (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: Implement `multiple-value-call` to pass all values as function arguments

**Independent Test**: Compile `(multiple-value-call #'+ (values 1 2) (values 3 4))` and verify result is 10

### Tests for User Story 7

- [ ] T069 [P] [US7] Unit test for mvc with single form in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T070 [P] [US7] Unit test for mvc with multiple forms in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp
- [ ] T071 [P] [US7] Unit test for mvc with floor results in tests/unit/multiple-values-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 7

- [ ] T072 [US7] Add multiple-value-call to special form dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T073 [US7] Implement compile-multiple-value-call: evaluate function reference in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T074 [US7] Implement compile-multiple-value-call: collect all values from each form into accumulator list in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T075 [US7] Implement compile-multiple-value-call: apply function with accumulated arguments in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T076 [US7] Verify tests pass

**Checkpoint**: All user stories complete

---

## Phase 11: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Integration tests, ANSI compliance verification, cleanup

- [ ] T077 [P] Integration test: full ANSI compliance scenarios in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T078 [P] Integration test: edge cases from spec.md in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T079 [P] Integration test: backward compatibility - single-value code unchanged in tests/integration/mv-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T080 Verify all generated Wasm validates with wasm-tools validate
- [ ] T081 Run quickstart.md verification commands
- [ ] T082 Update CLAUDE.md with 025-multiple-values completion notes

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: Skipped - using existing project
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: No dependencies - can start immediately - **BLOCKS all user stories**
- **User Stories (Phase 3-10)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
- **Polish (Phase 11)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

```
Phase 2 (Foundational)
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 3 (US1: values) â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
    â”‚       â”‚                                     â”‚                          â”‚
    â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 4 (US2: mvb) â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤                          â”‚
    â”‚       â”‚                                     â”‚                          â”‚
    â”‚       â””â”€â”€ Phase 5 (US8: floor/etc) â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€ Phase 6 (US3: mvl)     â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 7 (US4)  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 8 (US5)  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Phase 9 (US6)  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â”‚                  â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚       â””â”€â”€ Phase 10 (US7) â”‚
    â”‚                                             â”‚                          â”‚
    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
                                                                              â”‚
                                                              Phase 11 (Polish)
```

- **US1 (values)**: Foundational only - MVP target
- **US2 (mvb)**: Depends on US1 (needs values infrastructure)
- **US8 (arithmetic)**: Depends on US1 (needs values infrastructure)
- **US3 (mvl)**: Depends on US1+US2 (needs both for testing)
- **US4-7**: Can proceed after US1, independent of each other

### Within Each User Story

1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation
2. Implementation tasks execute sequentially within a story
3. Story complete when all tests pass

### Parallel Opportunities

- T001-T008: Sequential (dependencies)
- T009: Can run after T008
- T010-T013: All parallel (different test cases)
- T014-T017: Sequential (building up values implementation)
- T019-T023: All parallel (different test cases)
- T029-T032: All parallel (different arithmetic functions)
- T035-T037: All parallel (different arithmetic functions)
- T039-T041, T046-T048, T053-T055, T061-T062, T069-T071, T077-T079: Each group parallel

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together:
Task: T010 "Unit test for (values) returning NIL"
Task: T011 "Unit test for (values 42)"
Task: T012 "Unit test for (values 1 2 3)"
Task: T013 "Contract test for values Wasm codegen"

# After tests fail, implement sequentially:
Task: T014 "Add values to special form dispatch"
Task: T015 "Implement zero arguments case"
Task: T016 "Implement single argument case"
Task: T017 "Implement multiple arguments case"
Task: T018 "Verify tests pass"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T001-T009)
2. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (T010-T018)
3. **STOP and VALIDATE**: `(values 1 2 3)` compiles and returns correctly
4. Deliverable: Basic multiple values infrastructure

### P1 Complete (Stories 1, 2, 8)

1. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
2. Complete Phase 3: US1 (values)
3. Complete Phase 4: US2 (multiple-value-bind)
4. Complete Phase 5: US8 (floor/truncate/ceiling/round)
5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: `(multiple-value-bind (q r) (floor 7 3) ...)` works
6. Deliverable: Core multiple values functionality

### Full Implementation

1. P1 stories â†’ P2 stories â†’ P3 stories â†’ Polish
2. Each story adds capability without breaking previous

---

## Task Summary

| Phase | Story | Task Count |
|-------|-------|------------|
| 2 | Foundational | 9 |
| 3 | US1 (values) | 9 |
| 4 | US2 (mvb) | 10 |
| 5 | US8 (arithmetic) | 10 |
| 6 | US3 (mvl) | 7 |
| 7 | US4 (nth-value) | 7 |
| 8 | US5 (values-list) | 8 |
| 9 | US6 (mvp1) | 8 |
| 10 | US7 (mvc) | 8 |
| 11 | Polish | 6 |
| **Total** | | **82** |

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- Tests MUST fail before implementing (TDD per Constitution VII)
- Verify Wasm output with `wasm-tools validate` after each story
- Commit after each task or logical group

Looking at the file:
- Phase 2: T001-T009 (9 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 3: T010-T018 (9 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 4: T019-T028 (10 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 5: T029-T038 (10 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 6: T039-T045 (7 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 7: T046-T052 (7 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 8: T053-T060 (8 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 9: T061-T068 (8 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 10: T069-T076 (8 tasks) - all unchecked
- Phase 11: T077-T082 (6 tasks) - all unchecked

Total: 82 tasks, all unchecked in the file.

However, based on my implementation work, all the core functionality is implemented and working. The tasks.md file just wasn't updated with checkmarks.

The user is asking me to report based on the tasks.md file. All 82 tasks are unchecked in the file.
